name: Old Florence Inn Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: I am stunned by the positive reviews of this place. It is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at and I have travelled all over Europe, North America and Asia. We booked it because of the reviews on this site. When we arrived we were first surprised that it was on the third floor and the elevators were not readily apparent. We immediately noticed the drilling taking place on the upper floor and we were told it would only take place during the day and we were offered earplugs as a remedy!!!
reviews.title: Did I stay at the same place as the other reviewers?

reviews.text: The triple room we were assigned for three nights stank of cigarette smoke and the lady that was showing us the room denied that there was any smoking allowed in the room. She then showed us a room behing the check in desk which was much nicer, but very, very noisy from the traffic in the very busy street. She could only offer it to us for one night which we accepted as we were very tired. However, the airconditioning in the room was so bad, it might not have existed. There was also no air flow in the bathroom which was just the size of a cupboard. The breakfast tray was the most appalling that I have ever seen with instant coffee power, stale croissants in a packet and other inedible things. We hardly touched it when we checked out the next day by ourselves. There is no one in the hotel early in the morning when we checked out so we just left the keys on the desk and left. The noise from the traffice and police sirens (the area can be nasty at night) kept us up most of the night.
reviews.title: Charming Old Florence Inn

likes.disliked: — The directions from the train station could have been more exact

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The photos on the wall say that a lot of famous people stayed there, but I find that extremely hard to believe. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone despite the reviews on this site.
reviews.title: Great Spot!

reviews.text: We needed a triple room that we could afford so we had to stay in Bed & Breakfasts. The Old Florence Inn was quite charming and very helpful with my reservation and also getting me reservations for museums. They even called to confirm our wine tasting tour. We had a balcony, one double and one single bed in the room. The breakfast tray was really nice! The location is really close to the train station. I would recommend this B&B in Florence to anyone.
reviews.title: Awesome Location and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The Old Florence Inn was exactly what we were looking for in Florence. It was less than 2 blocks from the train station and heard no noise from the street nor the train station. Florio had been advised of our early check-in but the room was not available. A shower would have been nice. However, the SITA bus station was nearby to catch our bus to Siena. The room was large compared to the room in Rome. The bathroom was clean, the view was average, and the breakfast snacks were sufficient. We met with some friends who live in Florence and they were worried about the XXX Theater a couple of doors down, but the front gates were never opened and may have been shut down. Anyway, this spot was near everything and I am still kicking myself for grabbing that taxi to go to the Uffuzi Gallery. Don't waste the money because the Ponte Vecchio is only a 10-15 minute walk along flat streets. We had a great time and thanks to Florio and his staff there were zero problems.
reviews.title: Old Florence Inn couldn't have been better
Old Florence Inn
reviews.text: Great B& B .Close to everything. reat old fashioned rooms with modern facilities. Ask for room with balcony overlooking the busy street.

We stayed at Old Florence Inn at the end of April this year and absolutely loved it. We wished we could have stayed longer. Room was quite large especially after some of the other rooms we had around europe, very spacious and airey. bathroom was a decent size and always clean. We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony and didnt really have a lot of noise at all. Close to markets, and attractions with train just steps away. Breakfast was good and we enjoyed the selection.
reviews.title: Tuscan Treasure

reviews.text: Wonderful little B&B well worth the price and lovely helpful staff. We plan to stay here again on our next trip to Florence.
reviews.title: Great little place
A Gem!
reviews.text: What a lovely little b and b! The room was tasteful and immaculate. We enjoyed the food and beverage tray that was in the room for use all day, as well as a frig and a fruit bowl in the hallway. Handy to everything and good advice given by propriators. No complaints about this inn.

reviews.title: Nice room, good location
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in late May and feel like we found a hidden gem. For the very reasonable price of 95 euros per night, we had a beautiful, spacious room with immaculate bathroom, just a few steps from the train station and easily within walking distance to all major sights. The breakfast provided each morning was also a highlight, and we experienced no problems with noise from the street, even though our window faced the street. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Close to the train!
reviews.text: We stayed her over Easter this year. It was terrific value for what we got (we paid 89 Euros per night), however it was incredibly noisy.

reviews.title: Old Florence Inn
reviews.text: The rooms are really lovely and clean and the bathrooms are great (we had 2 rooms). Our room had a balcony with table which we did sit out and have a bottle of wine late one night which was nice.

reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Florence Inn
reviews.text: The problem was were were so close to train station so we got all the loud drunks, gypsies and late night revellers walking past or hanging outside late at night. There was also a busy bus stop right below our window (we were on the 2nd floor), we almost knew the bus timetable by the time we left!

reviews.title: Great site!
reviews.text: There were roller shutters which we thought would keep the noise out but this was only for light we discovered - it really felt like we were sleeping on a highway it was that noisy!
